intro: Minuartia kryloviana, commonly known as the Krylovian sandwort, is a low-growing, mat-forming plant native to the Arctic and subarctic regions. It typically thrives in rocky and sandy soils, often found in tundra and alpine environments. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring or early summer. Its leaves are narrow and succulent, adapted to retain moisture in harsh climates. Minuartia kryloviana is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family, characterized by its delicate structure and specialized adaptations to cold, nutrient-poor habitats.
